name: Royal Plaza on Scotts

reviews.title: Location, Location!
reviews.text: My daughter and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. The location is great, just round the corner from the centre of Orchard Rd and almost opposite Far East Plaza and Tangs. Also 2 mins from Orchard MRT station and Shaw Centre movie house. It is great value for the rate charged for such a central location. We had a deluxe room with two double beds which was adequate in size, housekeeping service was good and free minibar was a plus. Flat screen tv with free movie channel was also provided. Free internet service is available in business centre as well as free inroom internet if you take your own laptop.

reviews.title: Great location, and very reasonably priced.
reviews.text: We enjoyed drinks in the Heat Lounge one evening where a good resident band were playing. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Small but fine.
reviews.text: I often stay at the Royal Plaza in Singapore, and it has grown better over time. Recently the rooms have been refurbished and now have flat-screen TVs and new furnishings. Internet is free, and minibar is free too (2 beers and a few soft drinks). That's like slicing $30 off the price. The breakfast buffet is excellent, staff are very friendly and helpful, and security is good (you need to use your room key to access the guest floors in the elevator). The location is also great, as it is just 100m from the corner of Orchard and Scotts Roads. Lots of shopping centers all around. The view from the room is not so great if you are on a low floor, as you only see the building next door. Higher floors may be better, I've never paid the higher rate to find out.

reviews.title: Another Great Experience at Royal Plaza on Scotts
reviews.text: I much prefer the Royal Plaza over the Orchard or Orchard Parade hotels, which are in the same area and similar in price. The Hilton and the Negara hotels are also in the same area, and are better but considerably more expensive. I've stayed in all of them, and Royal Plaza is my top pick.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in great location
reviews.text: Central location, complimentary minibar, room was OK - clean but small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had three nights at this hotel over the Christmas period after completing a cruise from India. The staff were very helpful. The rooms were very clean. The Christmas decorations were gorgeous. Sadly all of this meant nothing when you couldn't sleep because of the noise caused by the other guests. The other guests at the hotel all seemed to have small children and none of them went to sleep before midnight. They all ran up and down the passageway outside our room. We changed rooms after one night but it was just as bad as before. Not the hotels fault but if you are looking for a quiet hotel this is not for you.
reviews.title: Too noisy

reviews.text: I heard so many great reviews for this hotel and decided to stay there even though I normally would stay at the Marriott. The concierge and doorman were absolutely horrible. I have to carry my own bags (come on, I m a lady) from my car which I had to park on the side of the hotel because their parking roofs were too low for my MPV. At first, they insisted that I parked at the shopping centre opposite the road but I refused because the parking fees would cost me a bomb and I have to walk to and fro to my car. I had to persuade the doorman to allow me to park my car at the side of the hotel even thought there was an available space on the main entrance and even gave my car keys to them to keep but the staff refused point blank and said the hotel has no jockey? How ridiculous. This would never happen at the Marriott with their superb jockeys and concierge by the way. Asians BEWARE! I observed how well they treated the Westerners but they wouldnt even glance at us or the other Asians that was there with even a smile. We felt very inferior there given the treatment that we received. Talk about double standards..! The rooms are okay and the location is great but I would rather pay more at the Marriott (which is directly opposite the hotel) because at least the staff there treated both Asians and Westerners equal...!
reviews.title: Double Standards with Horrible Doorman and Concierge

reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms and stayed there with family last week. Best location @ orchard road with 24-hour cafe a minute walk away. Very clean and being a non-smoking hotel, free of tobacco smell. Deluxe room is not very big but would accommodate 3 ( with extra bed) comfortably. Good & friendly service including that by the housekeepers.
reviews.title: Best location, clean hotel. Recommended

reviews.text: Definitely recommendable, especially if travelling with family. i would stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location but aged room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both my partner and I stayed at this hotel for three nights over Christmas. We were quickly and efficiently checked in and noticed a slight aged furniture. However please don't get it wrong, because the service in this hotel is impeccable. All the staff from concierge, restaurant including house keeping are all polite and friendly. The food at Carousel is generous and lives up to the qualitythat made it an award winning buffet restaurant. We were given Christmas cookies in our room. If there are any shortcomings I'm sure it has all been forgiven with top notch service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights during the Singapore GP. It is in a great location - very handy for shopping, restaurants and access to the rapid transit system. The rooms are a decent size, very clean and the beds were really comfortable. I don't know if all the bathrooms are the same but ours was very small. The staff were all amazing - the hotel was very busy during the GP but they were always smiling and helpful. The breakfast room was a little crazy in the morning but the selection was pretty good and the staff worked hard to get everyone seated as quickly as possible. My only complaint would be that the hallways looked a bit "tired" - the carpet looked like it needed replacing and there was quite often a musty, damp smell. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Reasonably priced business hotel on Orchard Rd
reviews.text: We stumbled across this hotel through a search for a reasonably-priced hotel in S'pore during Chinese New Year and found a great rate that seemed to be too good to be true. The amazing thing was that it was not--the hotel was excellent, and while we ended up upgrading to a slightly more expensive room at check in (since we had arrived early and our class of room was not yet ready), we appreciated that they threw breakfast in (at their very nice buffet).

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: One failing of this hotel is the gym, which was one of the reasons we chose it in the first place--it's got very rudimentary equipment, and much of it was not working properly. It really needs replacing!

I am sure it is possible to spend all day in the private lounge and not spend any money on food or drinks.

reviews.title: Great location and lounge

reviews.text: We originally had one room booked but when i asked for a rollaway i was informed that due to the configuration of the room a rollaway could not fit and that they could put us in a corner room where 1 rollaway would fit but the extra cost would be s$70++ I agreed to this. On arrival we checked in and i had to ask 3 times for a rollaway to be put in the room! On going to My sister in laws room (which was one of the original rooms we should have had) i realised that their room and our room were EXACTLY the same! This for me is bad practice if you have to upgrade me then thats fine but to actually move me to a room that you state is bigger to fit a rollaway when it in fact is not this is not good!

reviews.title: Shopping and Foods

reviews.text: Hotel fell below my expectations. Firstly, their was construction going on / refurbishment and we were not advised in advance. The bar upstairs was closed, the hotel lacked any vibrancy or energy. Secondly, we had to wait 1.5 hours for our room after a 7.5 hour flight from Dubai. We arrived at 12pm, and got into our hotel at 1.30pm. I normally wouldn't be so harsh, but apart from being tired we later found out that check out times were at 12pm - I don't see why the hotel didn't bend backwards to get a room cleaned at 12pm (in the meantime I was falling asleep on the couch in the lobby). Thirdly, massive line up for breakfast in the morning. It was ridiculous. Won't be staying there again.
reviews.title: Nothing distinctive ...... Only location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though there are renovations happening at the front of the hotel we were greeted warmly and checking in was a breeze. Room on the 7 th floor. Nice and clean, no bath but a lovely "Rain shower", very pleasant after a long flight. Mini bar stocked daily and was complimentary. Nespresso coffee machine and free pods. Iron and board. Safe. Flat screen TV. Nice toiletries. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Hair dryer. Singapore is very busy at the moment with the Grand Prix so plenty going on. Had room service and it arrived at our room in 15 mins, nice and hot and very tasty. Breakfast was $28pp but was worth it plenty of choices. Front desk rang a taxi for us and it arrived 15 mins early which was great as we were ready. Lovely pool. Would stay here any time. One downside our view was the building next door. Air con worked well. Room refreshed with new towels daily, and thoroughly cleaned. Free Internet. Business center available for use. Located right on Orchard road. Elevators.
reviews.title: Great value

Certainly a nice little bonus.

reviews.title: Royal Plaza - no place to sleep

reviews.text: I booked my stay directly with the hotel. I got a much better rate than the big travel sites, and it included an enormous breakfast buffet. The room was well furnished with a roomy and well equipped bath. It had a separate shower stall, but it had a waterfall showerhead and a hand held head. The hotel was quiet. The staff was great, especially Ibrahim at the concierge desk. The location was perfect. The MTR subway stop was a block away. There is an amazing amount of shopping and dining on Orchard Road. Taxis are very cheap, about S$16 from the airport to the hotel. The taxi drivers put the pedal to the metal, so hold on. The MTR line will take you to the downtown area. The hotel bar has a live band most of the nights. The lobby was was nicely decorate. There is free internet access at the business center for 15 minutes, if you need a pc to check email. There is also somone to help you with faxes and other things.
reviews.title: Great hotel on Orchard Road in Singapore
Great place to stay in Singapore
reviews.text: Had five days six night staying at the Royal Plaza. Whilst the room was basic it was well furnished, the view from our window was of a building next door but we just kept the blinds closed and didn't worry about it. The bar fridge is stocked daily with FREE ! small cans of softdrinks & beer (total of four ) and bottled water ( 2 or 3 if I recall ) Used the swimming pool & gym which are open from about 6.30am most mornings before going out into the humidity. Always used the pool upon our return in the afternoon to cool off.Great buffet breakfast kept us going until well in the afternoon.Looked in on the nightclub on the 1st floor but found drink prices were rather expensive, There is plenty of other entertainment within a two minute walk We visited the Multiplex cinema at the corner of Orchard Road on two occasions prices were Aust $ 5 each, a third of the price of cinemas in Australia. Borders Books and most other shops stay open to very late at night so it was not unusual to be shopping at close to midnight literally next door to the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was an MRT station about 5 mins walk away to speed tyou away in clean comfort to get to see some of the sites. The Singapore Botanical Gdns are a gentle though sweaty 20 minute walk. to the west . Great shopping nearby and countless restaurants would especially recommend the very clean and cheap food Court shops in the Tang Shopping Centre. Hotel staff were very attentive and cheerful always willing to assist with any enquires, check in was prompt and un-complicated especially after a long flight. Didn't use the wireless internet but the hotel has a small business centre with internet access although guests are restricted to 15mins useage, which was sufficient to check and send e-mails and arrange internet check in for the return flights. All in all a very memorable stay in Singapore

reviews.text: Check-in was ok, I was repeatedly advised that the hotel is strictly non-smoking (which I wouldn't have known becuase I couldn't have seen the half dozen signs in reception telling me and the declaration of a $300 per day "fee" for cleaning the room in the event that I did smoke on the check-in form). Despite this I was asked to sign an acceptance of this condition despite it not being mentioned at the time of booking. Regardless I was happy to sign as I do not smoke and hate being in a non-smoking room where somebody has smoked so this was all very acceptable if not unorthodox.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is quite small and poorly laid out (don't expect to use the bidet as there is no water pressure). The whole bathroom thing got worse the following morning. I rose early to catch my onward flight (6am) to discover that there was no hot water. I thought at first that it would just get warmer and I hopped in. Alas it was freezing for the entire shower so I woke up very quickly. When checking out I mentioned this and was told that I was in a corner room so it takes a while to heat up. There was no apology, no response to "how long does it take to heat up" unlike the repeated references to smoking at check-in. I therefore decided to give this hotel a miss for future trips as I like a hot (even a warm) shower in the mornings.
reviews.title: great place to base your Singapore trip
Brilliant place to stay in Singapore
reviews.text: Myself and my friend have just come back from Singapore. We stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts on the way out to New Zealand and on the way back. Absolutely beautiful hotel. Rooms are very comfortable. Complimentary drinks in fridge. Gorgeous swimming pool on 5th floor. Business centre free to use to check in on line for your flights and any other needs. Location on Scotts Road, in the Orchard Road area, so central for the shops. Taxis are cheap and you can get one outside the hotel really quickly. Well worth having the breakfast, so much to choose from and sets you up for the day. Staff are very helpful friendly and courteous. No hesitation in recommending this hotel. Will definitely stay there again if I go to Singapore.

reviews.text: Just spent 3 nights here on the first leg of my SE Asia trip. I couldn't fault the hotel in any way. The staff were incredibly friendly and efficient. Special thanks to the concierge desk for helping tp sort out my broken suitcase. The concierge desk also gave me great directions for walking and were happy to book a trip that wasn't theirs.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

aka: Royal Plaza On Scotts Hotel Singapore
description: 7-time winner of prestigious TTG award, Royal Plaza on Scotts is the leading business hotel in an excellent location near Orchard Road with free high-speed WIFI for multiple devices, minibar, local calls and Nespresso gourmet coffee in all smoke-free rooms. Minutes to central business, exhibition and convention districts, seconds to mega shopping malls, you will delight in the convenience of our location. Enjoy meals at award-winning buffet restaurant and exclusive access to swimming pool, 24hr Internet Lounge, and gym.
